text: HIT Entertainment Limited (stylized as HiT) was a children's entertainment company founded in 1982 as Henson International Television, the international distribution arm of The Jim Henson Company by Jim Henson, Peter Orton and Sophie Turner Laing. When Henson wanted to sell the company to Disney in 1989, Peter Orton took over the company. HIT owns and distributes children's television series including Thomas & Friends, Fireman Sam, Bob the Builder, Kipper, Oswald, Barney & Friends, Pingu and Angelina Ballerina.
